item.title: How Rebuilding My Blog Taught Me to Love CSS Again
item.description: This post is the story of how I rebuilt my blog from the ground up: no frameworks, no preprocessors - just hand-rolled CSS and semantic HTML. Along the way, I rediscovered the power of modern CSS and gained a new appreciation for the tools we now have. And yes, I did chase the elusive 100% Lighthouse score!

item.title: Providing Local JS and CSS Resources for CDN Fallbacks
item.description: In a recent podcast the topic of using Content Delivery Networks (CDN) to host commonly used resources such as jQuery and Twitter Bootstrap came up. The merits of having access to large-scale delivery infrastructure provided by Google etc. are significant.
